@ErisDS @github Hm, use an issue template and require certain steps to be done, otherwise you'll just close th issue?
@ErisDS @github Wow, sad to hear that.

@ErisDS @github Some projects don't allow issues at all, just PRs.
Or it there could be a bot, that highlights issues from paying users, so you can focus

@ErisDS @github on those.
I think something will has to give, it might mean that some valuable issues from newbies will get lost.
@ErisDS @github I've always find it valuable to invest in tools, because having the wrong ones will or bad processes costs so much energy and creates

@ErisDS @github "broken windows".
Having things that are broken and are not getting changed is terrible to have for some.
@ErisDS @github If GitHub is not helping you to make Ghost better, then this is a fair decision!
@ErisDS @github I have to recommendations: talk to @gr2m about this, if you haven't yet, and remove the core team from being the Gatekeeper for issues.
@ErisDS @github @gr2m Gregor will have some valuable tips ...
@ErisDS @github @gr2m Yes, and all those who don't want to get involved because of these issues.
